snippet: Turkish authorities took aim not just at the demonstrators in Taksim Square, but also at the medics who treated their injuries and the business owners who sheltered them.
abstract: Turkish authorities widen their crackdown on antigovernment protest movement, taking aim for first time at medics, business owners and foreign news media who have supported demonstrators; Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan, rallying hundreds of thousands of supporters at outdoor gathering, decries protesters as terrorists, making clear that time for compromise has passed.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO, SEBNEM ARSU and CEYLAN YEGINSU

lead_paragraph: Turkish authorities took aim not just at the demonstrators in Taksim Square, but also at the medics who treated their injuries and the business owners who sheltered them.

headline.main:
Turkey Expands
Violent Reaction to
Street Unrest
headline.print_headline: Turkey Expands Violent Reaction to Street Unrest
